ext2

Class Volume

  • java.lang.Object
    • ext2.Volume

  • public class Volume
extends java.lang.Object
    Name: Volume This class represents a volume the user wishes to open and read from. This class provides methods for initialising various fields that are contained in the file the user wishes to open, such as the superblock, group descriptor fields etc. If the volume is opened successfully a success message is printed, otherwise an error message is printed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Volume(java.lang.String filePath)
      Constructor used to open a file given a file path to that file.

      Returns the byte buffer which stores this entire volume, in bytes.

      Obtains the list of all group descriptors in this volume.
      int[] getiNodeTablePointers()
      Obtains the list of all iNode table pointers found in the group descriptors.
      SuperBlock getSuperblock()
      Obtains the reference to the superblock.
      int getTablePointerForiNode(int iNodeNumber, int iNodesPerGroup, int totaliNodes)
      Method to obtain the group number the iNode belongs to and the index in the array of iNode table pointers.
      boolean openVolume(java.lang.String filePath)
      Opens a given volume given a filename into an array of bytes and returns true if successful.

    • Method Detail

      • openVolume

        public boolean openVolume(java.lang.String filePath)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Opens a given volume given a filename into an array of bytes and returns true if successful.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The file path to the volume as a string.
        Returns:
        true if the file was successfully opened, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file couldn't be opened.

      • getTablePointerForiNode

        public int getTablePointerForiNode(int iNodeNumber,
                                   int iNodesPerGroup,
                                   int totaliNodes)
        Method to obtain the group number the iNode belongs to and the index in the array of iNode table pointers. The correct iNode table pointer can then be used to find the iNode required. E.g. A table index of 2 indicates the iNode exists in block group 2 and index 2 of the iNode table pointers is the table pointer to use.
        Parameters:
        iNodeNumber - The iNode number.
        iNodesPerGroup - The total number of iNodes per group.
        totaliNodes - The total number of iNodes in the filesystem.
        Returns:
        The table index (group number and index in array of iNode table pointers).

      • getGroupDescriptors

        public GroupDescriptor[] getGroupDescriptors()
        Obtains the list of all group descriptors in this volume.
        Returns:
        List of group descriptors.

      • getiNodeTablePointers

        public int[] getiNodeTablePointers()
        Obtains the list of all iNode table pointers found in the group descriptors.
        Returns:
        List of iNode table pointers.

      • getSuperblock

        public SuperBlock getSuperblock()
        Obtains the reference to the superblock.
        Returns:
        The superblock instance.

      • getByteBuffer

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer getByteBuffer()
        Returns the byte buffer which stores this entire volume, in bytes.
        Returns:
        The byte buffer of bytes in this volume.
